formatDescription: Windows Metafile is an image file format originally designed for Microsoft Windows in 1990. Windows Metafiles may contain both vector graphics and bitmap components.
provenanceCompoundName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

internalSignatures.name: Windows Metafile Image with Placeable File Header
internalSignatures.note:
Many applications that create metafiles prepend a 22-byte 'Placeable File Header' to the metafile: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms534075(v=vs.85).aspx

Magic number 0x9AC6CDD7,  2-byte handle, always 0, skip 16 bytes, File type (1 or 2), header size in words, always 9.

internalSignatures.name: Windows Metafile Image without Placeable File Header
internalSignatures.note: File type (1 or 2), header size in words, always 9. Version either 01 or 03

supportedBy.name: Microsoft Corporation
supportedBy.source: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

developedBy.name: Microsoft Corporation
developedBy.source: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives
